reviews.text: Stayed for a night at the hotel. I booked a superior room, but received a room with a standard size. When I asked why I was given a standard room, the staff confirmed it was a superior room, just a smaller one. I still wonder why the homepage then states that all superior rooms are 30-30m2 in size...I feel betrayed.
reviews.title: Ok to stay for a quick trip

reviews.text: The room itself was ok. The bed was cosy and clean, mattresses were clean, so was the bathroom. Though they should dust more carefully and the bathroom would need some renovation (paint chipping along the sink, bathtub and door).
reviews.title: Nice and convenient location
Great Location!
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was ok, could have been a little bigger.

reviews.title: Think twice!
reviews.text: The staff was friendly and the location was very good. Just a short walk away from the old town and bus station.
I would stay in this hotel again, in case I really get what I booked.
reviews.title: Sentralt

reviews.text: LOCATION
reviews.title: One of the best hotels ever!

reviews.text: Great location (for my purposes) near the old town and close to the Opera and the Riga Channel. 15 minutes by car from the airport. Across the street from the railway station.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel - central in Riga

reviews.text: ROOMS
reviews.title: Nice hotel in the center of Riga, very affordable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful rooms but could be more spacious. Clean with huge bathroom, big closets, desk, minibar and all necessary amenities. Steady door making the room very quiet. Very nice and soft beds. View from my room was into a backyard, could have been nicer.
reviews.title: Nice and Cozy, But the SPA was crappy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: AMENITIES
reviews.title: Made us feel welcome to Riga

reviews.text: Only good things to say 'bout the Opera hotel! There was some mess during check-in, but later they apologised with a bowl of fruits. I wouldn't say I like fruits, but in terms of attitude it was quite a pleasant move from their side. Booked a better than a standard room and really enjoyed it! In terms of location Opera Hotel is a very good choice - it is located just opposite the main train station, so alll the attractions are just a short stroll away.
reviews.title: They will make you enjoy your stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here between Christmas and New Year for three nights. Hotel was nice and clean and rooms were beautiful. Spa area was very small but very relaxing with one pool and two saunas.You need to make a reservation beforehand for the spa. They only let 8 people to go there at once. Breakfast was good but the breakfast room was too small and food ran out quickly. Excellent location!
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Train station, main streets, loud neighbors. Don't buy "garden view" — there are a few trees. No parking (the staff will tell you to park in the shopping mall across the station square). Nice room design.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: The hotel has recently undergone a full renovation and name change (can't recall what was the name before). Therefore everything was brand new which is, of course, always much better than run down properties ;) I have stayed with my grandma (who is 92 btw) and we enjoyed it. The location is very good - just across the road from the main train station. Old City Riga is within the walking distance (even for my grandma!).
reviews.title: Good value for money in Riga city center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived room was not ready yet, however, we were kindly offered some refreshments on the hotel account in the bar (tea is pictured). We had to wait about 20 minutes which was absolutely fine.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and spa

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for four nights, a great experience!
reviews.title: Nice hotel with a great location!

reviews.text: The staff is nice and friendly, the rooms clean and nice looking and the spa is good. We had a superior room, with access to the spa area for 1.5 hours a day ( treatments are not included). If you plan to relax at the hotel this is worth the little extra amount of money you pay.
reviews.title: A great place to stay in Riga

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is ordinary, neither a positive or negative experience.
reviews.title: Good Hotel - very central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What makes this hotel special is the relaxing atmosphere. The staff is great, and small things like making your bed ready for the night and placing a chocolate at your pillow while you're out dining in the evening, gives the extra touch that makes you want to come back!
reviews.title: Very cosy hotel

reviews.text: When you get all of this, and have walking distance to everything in the center of Riga, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice hotel in downtown Riga!
reviews.title: Great hotel
